title: Nikhat Zareen: India's New Boxing Queen, Wins Gold at IBA Women's World Championships
content:
India's Nikhat Zareen has etched her name in boxing history by securing the gold medal at the IBA Women's World Boxing Championships in Istanbul. The 25-year-old boxer dominated the 52kg category final, defeating Thailand's Jitpong Jutamas with a resounding 5-0 victory. 

This win makes Nikhat the fifth Indian woman to claim gold at the World Boxing Championships, joining the legendary Mary Kom, Sarita Devi, Jenny RL, and Lekha KC. She also brought home India's first gold medal in the tournament since Mary Kom's victory in 2018. 

Nikhat's dominance throughout the tournament was evident, showcasing her incredible skill and determination. She defeated several strong opponents, including Kazakhstan's Zhaina Shekerbekova and England's Charley-Sian Taylor Davison, to secure her place in the finals. 

With this impressive victory, Nikhat Zareen has solidified her place as a rising star in Indian boxing, and her future looks bright as she sets her sights on the Paris 2024 Olympics.
